A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The original and prequel trilogy had their flaws\, but were each original in both concepts and technology. Experimenting and exploring the strangeness of new worlds was of importance for George Lucas and something he wanted a fresh look at for each trilogy.\nThe sequels meanwhile bring nothing new to the table. They're shallow action movies set in a rehash of the original setting with nonsensical and character breaking arcs and plots.
